meanings.definition: Exaggeratedly theatrical or extravagant in style, typically appealing to popular or undiscriminating taste.
meanings.sent1: The play was the campiest production I had ever seen, with over-the-top costumes and dramatic acting.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so campy, filled with exaggerated characters and flashy sets.
meanings.sent3: The campiest part of the party was when everyone started dancing like they were in a musical.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was the campiest thing at the event, standing out like a neon sign in a sea of black suits.
meanings.sent5: The campiest decorations at the carnival were the giant, glittering unicorns that greeted visitors at the entrance.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to camp; campy behavior or style.
meanings.sent1: The campiest jokes at the comedy show had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The TV show had a campy vibe, with its bright colors and quirky characters.
meanings.sent3: She had a campiest way of telling stories, always adding a funny twist to make everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The campiest moments of the road trip were when they sang cheesy songs at the top of their lungs.
meanings.sent5: The campiest part of the play was when the characters broke into a spontaneous dance number, much to the audience's delight.
